pullrequest.title: Ensure that the UCRT headers are included only if are found

content.raw:
On a recent  Windows 10 with CMake 3.17 does include are not necessary, and the find logic of CMake to find the include headers does not work.  
However, apparently the logic works fine on the Jenkins jobs, so to avoid breaking those we just include the directory if it is correctly found.

This fixes issue [#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2701/compilation-error-on-windows-due-to-not](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2701/compilation-error-on-windows-due-to-not) .

‌
content.html:
On a recent Windows 10 with CMake 3.17 does include are not necessary, and the find logic of CMake to find the include headers does not work.
However, apparently the logic works fine on the Jenkins jobs, so to avoid breaking those we just include the directory if it is correctly found.

This fixes issue #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2701/compilation-error-on-windows-due-to-not .

pullrequest.title: Ensure that the UCRT headers are included only if are found

content.raw: Thanks for the workaround Silivio. I have no idea how the UCRT headers were useful or introduced. Reading the reference issue looks to me like there is no harm on merging this workaround.
content.html: Thanks for the workaround Silivio. I have no idea how the UCRT headers were useful or introduced. Reading the reference issue looks to me like there is no harm on merging this workaround.
